article_metadata.author: The Apothecary

og.description: Insurers should be free to offer copper, or lead, or brass or whatever policy they want. However, as long as the federal government is subsidizing insurers billions of dollars in these exchanges, it should offer some of the money for beneficiaries’ direct use, via deposits in Health Savings Accounts, Health Reimbursement Arrangements, or Flexible Spending Arrangements, instead of handing it over to insurers. Many healthy, young people would surely prefer to spend money directly on medical care, rather than be forced to buy a health-insurance policy with a deductible so high they will likely never benefit from it.
og.title: Obamacare's Metallic Plans - Add Cash As Well As Copper
